title: Processes - Diff Eq Separation of Variables

content.question: What are all solutions to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x times the natural log of 2, end fraction " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator the natural log of x, and denominator the natural log of 2, end fraction, plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator x raised to the, open parenthesis, 1 minus the natural log of 2, close parenthesis, power, and denominator, open parenthesis, 1 minus the natural log of 2, close parenthesis, end fraction, plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator negative 1, and denominator x squared, times the natural log of 2, end fraction, plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, e raised to the x times the natural log of 2, power, plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator the natural log of x, and denominator the natural log of 2, end fraction, plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.6: Finding General Solutions Using Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
